channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown trees, 24th September
item.description:
Branches are hanging over the fence of our communal garden making it unusable for our children. The trees are on the side of the fence of the river Thames path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinthian Manorway, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light number 33 Chevening, 24th September
item.description:
Light not working

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chevening Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in and around communal bin shed, 24th September
item.description:
This issue is ongoing, and I am unsure whether it is being caused by fellow residents or others. However, it is unacceptable, as it is both unhygienic and attracting vermin. It is also causing disruption to other residents, as this is the main pathway to the river for the whole estate. Action needs to be taken to resolve this matter—whether through signage, CCTV, or another effective deterrent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Galleon Close, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Unswept debris, 24th September
item.description:
The footpath has been strimmed of the vegetation that was massively overgrown. But who ever strimmed it hasn’t cleared it up . Its a complete mess and looks worse than it did before. Please can someone go and look at the shoddy work thst has been left. Thankyou
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blackfen, London

item.title: Dumped rubbish been left for months, 24th September
item.description:

item.title: Human Excrement STILL in stairwell, 24th September
item.description:
The excrement is still there, I can see there has been some sort of attempt to clean up by spraying it with water but all it has done is spread it around more and now the dirty water remains in a large puddle making it impassable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hertford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light out above 20mph sign., 24th September
item.description:
The light is out above the 20mph sign on street lamp 1 at the Parry Street entrance of Vauxhall Bus Station. Outside the Shop and Go store (61 Bondway SW8).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bondway, Vauxhall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The speedbumps at the corner of aldenham street, 24th September
item.description:
The white arrows on the speedbump have been spray painted with red crosses. This has defaced the speedbump and made the road markings less clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Werrington Street, Somers Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet again another stench coming from the drains, 24th September
item.description:
Outside my house yet again from the drains is an awful smell, this affects me and my family greatly as it’s strong outside our door. Before you say it’s Thames water problem it is NOT. They have been and said it’s not the sewage line and that it’s the council responsibility. I have been passed back and forward between you and Thames water it’s becoming and a joke. I pay my council tax for stuff like this. Please get someone to have a look.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Normandy Way, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 52, 24th September
item.description:
The pavement is cracking / cracked due to the tree roots. Reported before and has been present for months now. Dangerous to the elderly using walking sticks and those who are vulnerable to falls. I have seen two people twist their ankle on the pavement. It has also cracked number 52s stone porch , and the crack is becoming worse causing property damage

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Esmond Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
